Class SuperBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • SuperBlock
  • public class SuperBlock
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to represent the superblock from the volume. In the ext2 file system this always starts at byte offset = 1024.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SuperBlock​(byte[] content)
      Constructor that allows the creation of the superblock within any volume of a ext2 type of file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Method that extracts the details of the file from the superblock.

      Accessor that retrieves the total number of blocks of information from the file.
      int getBlocksInGroup()
      Accessor that retrieves the total number of blocks in the file.
      int getGroupNumber()
      Accessor that retrieves the total number of blocks in the file.
      int getiNodeNumber()
      Accessor that retrieves the total number of inodes in the file.
      int getiNodesInGroup()
      Accessor that retrieves the number of inodes in a single group.
      int getiNodeSize()
      Accessor that retrieves the size of inodes in a file .
      int getMagicNumber()
      Accessor that retrieves the "magic number" of any ext2 file.
      java.lang.String getVolume()
      Accessor that retrieves the name of the volume.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SuperBlock

        public SuperBlock​(byte[] content)
        Constructor that allows the creation of the superblock within any volume of a ext2 type of file.
        Parameters:
        content - is an array of bytes read from the filesystem-image. The constructor also modifies the order the bytes within the buffer by @param ByteOrder.LITTLE_ENDIAN (MSB is first).

    • Method Detail

      • extractDetails

        public void extractDetails()
        Method that extracts the details of the file from the superblock. The method uses the specified offsets to reach specific blocks of information and convert that to either hex or int. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The method also prints the extracted details on the command line.
        Parameters:
        volumeName - = the name of the File.
        magicNumberCopy - = hex representation of the ext2 "magic number".
        iNodeNumber - = the total number of inodes in the given file.
        iNodesInGroup - = the total number of inodes in a given group.
        iNodeSize - = the size of all the inodes in the volume.
        blockNumber - = the number of blocks in the volume.
        blocksInGroup - = the number of blocks in a given group.
        fileSystemBlockSize - = the size of a block in the filesystem.
        groupNumber - = total number of groups in a file.

      • getVolume

        public java.lang.String getVolume()
        Accessor that retrieves the name of the volume.
        Returns:
        the name of the filesystem as a string

      • getMagicNumber

        public int getMagicNumber()
        Accessor that retrieves the "magic number" of any ext2 file.
        Returns:
        a int representation of the number.

      • getiNodeNumber

        public int getiNodeNumber()
        Accessor that retrieves the total number of inodes in the file.
        Returns:
        a int representing the total number of inodes in the file.

      • getBlockNumber

        public int getBlockNumber()
        Accessor that retrieves the total number of blocks of information from the file.
        Returns:
        an int representing the number of blocks in the file.

      • getiNodeSize

        public int getiNodeSize()
        Accessor that retrieves the size of inodes in a file .
        Returns:
        an int representing the size of all inodes in a filesystem.
